channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.

item.title: The NHL postpones a game and the Lakers coach evacuates his family amid LA fires
item.description: The fires burning across Los Angeles have affected tens of thousands of people, including athletes and staff for the city's sports teams. Pasadena's iconic Rose Bowl was under evacuation warning.
item.content:encoded:
The fires burning across Los Angeles have affected tens of thousands of people, including athletes and staff for the city's sports teams. Pasadena's iconic Rose Bowl was under evacuation warning.

(Image credit: Harry How)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Fire hydrants ran dry in Pacific Palisades as a major wildfire raged
item.description: Janisse Quiñones, CEO of the Los Angeles Department of Water and Power, said the fight to contain the flames has put immense strain on the system.
item.content:encoded:
Janisse Quiñones, CEO of the Los Angeles Department of Water and Power, said the fight to contain the flames has put immense strain on the system.

(Image credit: Etienne Laurent)
item.dc:creator: Alina Hartounian

item.title: Is Democracy Holding Up in South Korea?
item.description: Authorities in South Korea are continuing to try to arrest impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol, following his failed declaration of martial law over a month ago. As the country continues to be mired in political crisis, analyst are studying the health of the country's democracy. And as our correspondent in Seoul tells us, they're drawing comparisons to recent events in the U.S.
item.content:encoded: Authorities in South Korea are continuing to try to arrest impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol, following his failed declaration of martial law over a month ago. As the country continues to be mired in political crisis, analyst are studying the health of the country's democracy. And as our correspondent in Seoul tells us, they're drawing comparisons to recent events in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Wildfires displace thousands and ravage greater Los Angeles
item.description:
Extremely dry conditions coupled with high winds have led to an explosive wildfire situation in southern California.

Multiple fires have erupted across the Los Angeles area since Tuesday. Tens of thousands of people have had to evacuate, and firefighters are struggling to contain the flames.

Adria Kloke is one of the of people who has had to flee. She packed up her belongings, along with her cat, and left her home in Pacific Palisades on Tuesday. Kloke shares her story with NPR.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org

Email us at considerthis@npr.org
item.content:encoded:
Extremely dry conditions coupled with high winds have led to an explosive wildfire situation in southern California.

Multiple fires have erupted across the Los Angeles area since Tuesday. Tens of thousands of people have had to evacuate, and firefighters are struggling to contain the flames.

Adria Kloke is one of the of people who has had to flee. She packed up her belongings, along with her cat, and left her home in Pacific Palisades on Tuesday. Kloke shares her story with NPR.

(Image credit: Apu Gomes)

item.title: As winter storms surge across the country, here's how one homeless shelter is coping
item.description: NPR visited a homeless shelter in Washington, D.C., to see how residents and staff are faring during a cold emergency. The shelter is busy year-round, though the frigid weather brings in more people.
item.content:encoded:
NPR visited a homeless shelter in Washington, D.C., to see how residents and staff are faring during a cold emergency. The shelter is busy year-round, though the frigid weather brings in more people.

(Image credit: Dee Dwyer)
item.dc:creator: James Doubek

item.title: How to get more movement into your screen-filled life. No gym required.
item.description: Research shows that 5-minute walking breaks every half hour offset the harm of too much sitting. But that is easier said than done. These 5 tips can help you maintain movement throughout your day.
item.content:encoded: Research shows that 5-minute walking breaks every half hour offset the harm of too much sitting. But that is easier said than done. These 5 tips can help you maintain movement throughout your day.
item.dc:creator: Manoush Zomorodi

item.title: What are the Santa Ana winds and how are they impacting the LA wildfires?
item.description: Although the Santa Anas are a routine part of life for people living in southern California, the winds are particularly violent and destructive this time around, experts say.
item.content:encoded:
Although the Santa Anas are a routine part of life for people living in southern California, the winds are particularly violent and destructive this time around, experts say.

(Image credit: Apu Gomes)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: A record 24 million people now get Obamacare health plans. Will it last under Trump?
item.description: Enrollment in Affordable Care Act health insurance plans has grown every year of the Biden administration, leading to a record high rate of people with insurance.
item.content:encoded: Enrollment in Affordable Care Act health insurance plans has grown every year of the Biden administration, leading to a record high rate of people with insurance.
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Girl Scouts are retiring two cookie flavors (don't worry, your Thin Mints are safe)
item.description: 2025 will be the last time you can buy Girl Scout S'mores and Toast-Yay! cookies. They join the ranks of many other discontinued flavors — RIP Mango Cremes with Nutrifusion and cheesy Golden Yangles.
item.content:encoded:
2025 will be the last time you can buy Girl Scout S'mores and Toast-Yay! cookies. They join the ranks of many other discontinued flavors — RIP Mango Cremes with Nutrifusion and cheesy Golden Yangles.

(Image credit: Nova Safo)
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Here's where things stand for several major landmarks in the Los Angeles fires
item.description: The fires raging across Los Angeles are putting some cultural institutions in danger.
item.content:encoded:
The fires raging across Los Angeles are putting some cultural institutions in danger.

(Image credit: Apu Gomes)
item.dc:creator: Dhanika Pineda
